New Records: Nick Martinez set a Cincinnati Reds franchise record with a strikeout-to-walk ratio of 6.44 for pitchers who threw 140 or more innings in a season.
Key Match Events: Nick Martinez threw eight innings in a complete game, 1-0 loss against the Cubs without walking anyone and picking up three strikeouts.
Post-Match Reflections: Nick Martinez is likely to decline his player option for the 2025 season and enter free agency, where he is expected to earn more than the $12,000,000 the Reds would pay him.
There is speculation about whether the Reds will make Martinez a qualifying offer, which has been in the $18-21,000,000 range in recent years.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game lasted 1 hour and 48 minutes, reminiscent of Tom Browning's fast games.
